text:
The calendar example web application doesn't encode its entries,
so if you add a new appointment "solve a<b", it will show as "solve a".

I realise this is only an example, but it claims in login.html:

  It demostartes a way JSP can be used with html tables and forms.

so it ought to demonstrate how to do it correctly. (BTW, note also the typo)
creator: mak-apache-bugzilla@greenhills.co.uk

text: Will deal with it in a future version.
creator: craig.mcclanahan@sun.com

text:
For completeness: I've placed a patch for this on
http://www.greenhills.co.uk/mak/apache/, files tomcat-cal.diff
and HTMLEncoder.java

It uses a spearate HTMLEncoder class to do the encoding, as I'm not
aware of there being a standard java/servlet/jsp implementation of
this functionality. I suggest placing the file in WEB-INF/classes in case
any other examples need it too.
creator: mak-apache-bugzilla@greenhills.co.uk

text: In 4.1.3 Beta, the calendar exemple encodes all of its output.
